question.body: Can we use the two-sample t-test to test this claim?

explanation.p: (i) Since each of the samples is random, we can assume that the samples are independent.
(ii) Since the sample sizes (both 25) are not large, for the two-sample t-test to be reliably used the two populations need to be (at least close) to normal.

Indeed, when we look at the histograms of the samples, we see no violations of the normality assumption. On the contrary, both histograms have a shape which is close to normal. (Click here to see the histograms.) In conclusion, we can reliably use the two-sample t-test in this case.
